Articles.Content:
If you didn't know after the C5T1 capsule detached and returned to earth, the service module "flew" away from destruction and began its extended mission.

First it flew to the moon, then to L2 where it has camped out for a while doing tests and practising things.

But now we have it's schedule:

January-leave L2 to enter close lunar orbit

February-science

March-rendezvous and docking practise in lunar orbit via remote control+automation

April-scan and photo in HD the next landing sites and good soil sample areas.

If it survives past April it will enter the "extended extended mission" which is still being discussed, some want more tests while others want it to rendezvous with an asteroid (which has already been picked out, can't remember name).

So far the probe is doing great, this could be China's greatest deep space probe yet (I know theres only 3 others but...).
